DataElement.preferredName: Diabetes Mellitus Index Date To Diagnosis Day Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Number of days between the date used for index and the date the patient was diagnosed with diabetes mellitus.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Diabetes Mellitus Index Date To Diagnosis Day
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization._A date used as a reference point for ensuing events, often a diagnosis date, or a first visit date, or the date a patient enrolled in a study._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._The investigation, analysis and recognition of the presence and nature of disease, condition, or injury from expressed signs and symptoms; also, the scientific determination of any kind; the concise results of such an investigation._The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: (dye-a-BEE-teez) A disease in which the body does not properly control the amount of sugar in the blood. As a result, the level of sugar in the blood is too high. This disease occurs when the body does not produce enough insulin or does not use it properly.

Concepts.definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by abnormally high blood sugar levels due to diminished production of insulin or insulin resistance/desensitization.

This also refers to a specific day.
